Description: AWS Control Tower is a management and governance service that you can use to navigate through the setup process and governance requirements that are involved in creating a multi-account AWS environment.

Requirements.Name: Disallow launch of EC2 instance types that are not EBS-optimized
Requirements.Description: Checks whether EBS optimization is enabled for your EC2 instances that can be EBS-optimized

Requirements.Name: Disallow EBS volumes that are unattached to an EC2 instance
Requirements.Description: Checks whether EBS volumes are attached to EC2 instances

Requirements.Name: Enable encryption for EBS volumes attached to EC2 instances
Requirements.Description: Checks whether EBS volumes that are in an attached state are encrypted

Requirements.Name: Disallow internet connection through RDP
Requirements.Description: Checks whether security groups that are in use disallow unrestricted incoming TCP traffic to the specified

Requirements.Name: Disallow internet connection through SSH
Requirements.Description: Checks whether security groups that are in use disallow unrestricted incoming SSH traffic.

Requirements.Name: Disallow access to IAM users without MFA
Requirements.Description: Checks whether the AWS Identity and Access Management users have multi-factor authentication (MFA) enabled.

Requirements.Name: Disallow console access to IAM users without MFA
Requirements.Description: Checks whether AWS Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is enabled for all AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users that use a console password.

Requirements.Name: Enable MFA for the root user
Requirements.Description: Checks whether the root user of your AWS account requires multi-factor authentication for console sign-in.

Requirements.Name: Disallow public access to RDS database instances
Requirements.Description: Checks whether the Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) instances are not publicly accessible. The rule is non-compliant if the publiclyAccessible field is true in the instance configuration item.

Requirements.Name: Disallow public access to RDS database snapshots
Requirements.Description: Checks if Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) snapshots are public. The rule is non-compliant if any existing and new Amazon RDS snapshots are public.

Requirements.Name: Disallow public read access to S3 buckets
Requirements.Description: Checks that your S3 buckets do not allow public read access.

Requirements.Name: Disallow public write access to S3 buckets
Requirements.Description: Checks that your S3 buckets do not allow public write access.

Requirements.Name: Disallow RDS database instances that are not storage encrypted
Requirements.Description: Checks whether storage encryption is enabled for your RDS DB instances.

Requirements.Name: Disallow S3 buckets that are not versioning enabled
Requirements.Description: Checks whether versioning is enabled for your S3 buckets.
